title: Ciabot Berton 2014 Fisetta  (Barbera d'Alba)
description: Aromas of black cherry, ground pepper, clove and chopped herb jump out of the glass and carry over to the vibrant, easy-drinking palate. Racy acidity and round tannins support the juicy fruit. It's made for sheer drinking pleasure so enjoy soon.

title: Claudio Alario 2011  Barolo
description: Aromas that recall underbrush, oak, espresso, truffle and mocha unfold on this bracing red. The firm palate offers dried dark berry, sawdust, espresso, anise and ground pepper alongside assertive tannins.

title: Conterno Fantino 2014 Vignota  (Barbera d'Alba)
description: Aromas of plum, blackberry, violet and exotic spice jump out of the glass. The bright, polished palate offers black cherry, raspberry jam and black pepper alongside fresh acidity. It's made for immediate drinking pleasure so enjoy soon.

title: Coppo 2013 Cascina Gavelli  (Barbera d'Asti)
description: Spiced blueberry, ripe plum and tilled earth aromas lead the nose on this hearty wine. Made with no added sulfites, the big, chewy palate delivers juicy black cherry, ripe blackberry and licorice alongside the warmth of evident alcohol.

title: Cuatro Pasos 2012 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: It has been a while since we've reviewed Cuatro Pasos, but eight vintages later it's basically the same wine, which, for the price, means good value. This opens with earthy warm muddled berry aromas. The palate is flush and plump, reflective of a hot vintage, while blackberry and cassis flavors finish hefty. Drink now.

title: D'Arenberg 2012 The Feral Fox Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: The ample alcohol in this wine imparts a rich slightly syrupy feel to this wine that's not particularly Pinot-like, but still satisfying. Strawberry and raspberry notes carry a hint of tomato leaf, then finish with crisp acids.

title: David Hill 2013 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Soft and buttery, this drink-now style is as smooth as a polished stone. The fruit is fairly generic and light, but the penetrating punch of popcorn and nut oil carries it along nicely.

title: Domaine Céline et Frédéric Gueguen 2014  Petit Chablis
description: Petit Chablis is planted on the plateau above the Serein river valley, the heart of Chablis. This attractively fruity wine offers white fruits and crisp acidity. Light and refreshing, it is ready to drink.

title: 1848 Winery 2012 Fifth Generation Chardonnay (Judean Hills)
description: This easy-drinking wine has a bouquet of honeydew melon and lime juice. Flavors of lemon, tangerine, guava and white peach with a soft hint of baking spice continue into the finish, which is marked by flavors of stone fruits and nutmeg.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2013 Branco Reserva White (Alenteo)
description: With the normally more northern Alvarinho in the blend, this wine has considerable freshness. That is mitigated by the wood aging that has broadened the wine and brought out tropical and yellow fruit flavors. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Premium Branco White (Alentejo)
description: This is a pale colored wine, a blend of local grapes and deliciously fresh. It is rounded and smooth, touched by citrus and fresh tangerines. Ripe and fruity, it is ready to drink now.

title: Adega de Favaios NV 10 Anos  (Moscatel do Douro)
description: As with tawny Ports, the other Douro fortified wine, Moscatel, is aged in wood for an average of a decade. In this 10-year old, the wine still has its fruit, but it is just starting to show old wood aging flavors that are beginning to concentrate it. There is a strongly perfumed, spicy aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Ancient Cellars 2014 Old Mill Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Barrel-fermented in neutral oak, this is ready to drink, softly flavorful with yellow apple and other yellow fruits, and a warm, autumnal mouthfeel. Drink now through 2018.

title: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This ripe Chardonnay has a soft texture and only the lightest minerality. It is fresh, tangy with lemon-zest flavors and refreshing acidity. The aftertaste with a burst of crispness is particularly attractive.

title: Battle Creek 2013 Unconditional Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: The aromas of wild strawberries, spice and sarsaparilla are immediate in their appeal. The palate is light bodied and elegant, with mouthwatering acids and flavors that linger. This wine is delicate but brings a lot of enjoyment.

title: Benegas 2011 Luna Benegas Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Solid dark-berry aromas are dense and deep. This has a plump forward fruity palate with concentrated, toasty flavors of blackberry and dark plum. On the finish, this remains fruity and compact, with more than enough body weight.

title: Bernardus 2014 Rosé (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Light pink in the glass, this Pinot Noir-based wine shows pink lemonade, lime and watermelon on the nose alongside wet cement. There is lots of tangy power and fresh energy on the palate, with lemon-zest flavors making the tongue sizzle and cleaning the mouth perfectly.

title: Caldera 2012 Balmet  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
description: Aromas of mature plum, espresso, toast and Asian spice lead the nose while the dense palate delivers dried black cherry, red currant, licorice and ground pepper. Tangy acidity and close-grained tannins give it a mouth-puckering finish.

title: Caldera 2012  Barbera d'Asti Superiore
description: Aromas of baked plum, scorched earth, mint and menthol come together in the glass. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, raisin, ground pepper and a hint of Oriental spice accompanied by close-grained tannins. A licorice note closes the finish.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2014 Stainless Unoaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Zesty aromas of just-cut apple, lemon-lime soda and tuberose meet a stony quality on the nose of this popular wine from the Edna Valley producer. It's fresh and crisp on the palate, with ripe apples, kiwi and sea-salt flavors.

title: Big Table Farm 2013 Cattrall Brothers Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This wine offers clean, slightly dilute raspberry fruit, along with lovely aromatics and a persistent, engaging finish. In spite of the lightness, it holds your interest.

title: Big Table Farm 2013 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Solidly built, almost chunky, the accent flavors suggest time spent in a percentage of new wood. Citrus and apple are cloaked in oaky spices and barrel flavors of toast, vanilla and butter.

title: Boasso 2011 Gabutti  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas of prune, resin, mature dark berry and cake spice. The palate is tight and a bit raw, showing sour cherry, licorice, toast and espresso alongside bracing tannins.

title: Bodegas San Valero 2010 Particular Viñas Centenarias Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Ripe rustic woody aromas of berry fruits and cedar introduce a raw rugged drawing palate with oaky baked lightly medicinal flavors of candied berry fruits. Grabby tannins, heat and spicy flavors push the finish on this firmly structured Garnacha. Drink through 2018.

title: Braida di Giacomo Bologna 2013 Montebruna  (Barbera d'Asti)
description: Aromas of black raspberry, violet, baking spice and a whiff of game lead the nose. The chewy palate offers juicy sour cherry, ground pepper and licorice alongside racy acidity and round tannins. It's meant to be drunk young so enjoy soon.

title: Durigutti 2013 HD Clásico Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Dark spicy aromas of black plum and black currant are solid. In the mouth, this is saturated and hard, with heavy overall density and strong tannins. A dark, spicy, blackened set of dark-berry flavors finishes with more spice and mint than fruit.

title: El Hijo 2009 Prodigo Reserva Malbec (La Consulta)
description: Stalky aromas of leathery berry fruits suggest animal and earth. This is raw, tannic and hard on the palate, with saucy berry flavors that fall off towards stalky and stewy. A dense tannic finish is structured but tastes herbal and stalky.

title: Los 800 2012 Red (Priorat)
description: Leathery stalky berry aromas come across as being baked and rough. This is full and grabby on the palate with cooked blackberry and prune flavors that end dark, and spicy with notes of licorice and herbs.

title: Lumos 2013 Five Blocks Wren and Temperance Hill Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This Pinot does not shy away from some sharp, slightly bitter herbal flavors, but keeps them in balance against a core of tart cranberry fruit. It's well made and solid, with medium-long persistence.
designation: Five Blocks Wren and Temperance Hill

title: Lusso Della Terra 2011 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: A showy nose of violet perfume and grape candy emerges from this bottling. Similar flavors persist on the palate, along with a touch of licorice. The wine is not overly complex, but it's quite easy to quaff.
